title: Coventry BS launches top-paying 2.35% Poppy savings bond
text:
Coventry BS launches top-paying 2.35% Poppy savings bond Coventry BS launches top-paying 2.35% Poppy savings bond SAVERS can this year bank a top 2.35 per cent with the Coventry Building Society's Poppy Bond. PUBLISHED: 15:58, Fri, Oct 23, 2015 | UPDATED: 16:14, Fri, Oct 23, 2015 GETTY You can get a good return on Poppy Bonds and support the Royal British Legion 
The three-year account is fixed until 2018 and the society is donating 0.15 per cent of a customer's total balance to the Royal British Legion. The provider has already donated £12million to the worthy charity through the saving bonds since 2008. Experts have urged conscientious savers who want to support the cause to move fast. Rachel Springall, finance expert at Moneyfacts.co.uk, said: "Coventry Building Society has unveiled the highly popular Poppy Bond earlier than in previous years, and savers won’t be disappointed thanks to its attractive rate of 2.35 per cent yearly.“As always, the Poppy Bond will only be available for a limited period of time, so if savers want one, they must act fast. "Last November the Poppy Bond was only on the market for 13 days before it was withdrawn, which just goes to show how quickly a good deal gets snapped up." Related articles
